law.text: No person shall sell live crayfish, mud eels, spring lizards, fish, aquatic invertebrates, or amphibians for bait to be used in taking fishes, nor live fishes for stocking or fishing purposes unless he has obtained a live fish and bait dealer's license.
law.history: Amended 1994 Ky. Acts ch. 239, sec. 7, effective July 15, 1994. -- Amended 1968 Ky. Acts ch. 38, sec. 25 -- Amended 1952 Ky. Acts ch. 200, sec. 66 -- Created 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 68, sec 50.
